intro: Ceropegia murlensis, commonly known as the Murla's ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
